pageContext.claim: “But we've taken the oil [in Syria]. And the soldiers that we have there are the ones guarding the oil. We have the oil. So that's all we have there.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump’s language suggests the United States is taking control of the oil. But the U.S. military does not seize foreign oil because it’s against international law “to destroy or seize the enemy’s property.” Moreover, Syria was not a major oil producer even before the civil war. Trump suggests, falsely, that all U.S. soldiers are coming home except for one who will guard "the oil." That's false too.
